What does the `listaddressgroupings` command do in Verus?
The `listaddressgroupings` command lists groups of addresses that have had their common ownership made public by common use as inputs or as the resulting change in past transactions.

listaddressgroupings Lists groups of addresses which have had their common ownership made public by common use as inputs or as the resulting change in past transactions Result: [  [   [    "VRSC address",   (string) The VRSC address    amount,         (numeric) The amount in VRSC    "account"       (string, optional) The account (DEPRECATED)   ]   ,...  ]  ,... ] Examples: > verus listaddressgroupings > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listaddressgroupings", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/listaddressgroupings
What is the format of the result returned by the `listaddressgroupings` command?

The result returned by the `listaddressgroupings` command is a list of lists, where each inner list contains objects with the following properties:
* `address`: a string representing the VRSC address
* `amount`: a numeric value representing the amount in VRSC
* `account`: an optional string representing the account (DEPRECATED)

listaddressgroupings Lists groups of addresses which have had their common ownership made public by common use as inputs or as the resulting change in past transactions Result: [  [   [    "VRSC address",   (string) The VRSC address    amount,         (numeric) The amount in VRSC    "account"       (string, optional) The account (DEPRECATED)   ]   ,...  ]  ,... ] Examples: > verus listaddressgroupings > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listaddressgroupings", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/listaddressgroupings
How can I use the `listaddressgroupings` command in the command line?
You can use the `listaddressgroupings` command in the command line by simply running `verus listaddressgroupings`.

listaddressgroupings Lists groups of addresses which have had their common ownership made public by common use as inputs or as the resulting change in past transactions Result: [  [   [    "VRSC address",   (string) The VRSC address    amount,         (numeric) The amount in VRSC    "account"       (string, optional) The account (DEPRECATED)   ]   ,...  ]  ,... ] Examples: > verus listaddressgroupings > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listaddressgroupings", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/listaddressgroupings
How can I use the `listaddressgroupings` command with the JSON-RPC API?

You can use the `listaddressgroupings` command with the JSON-RPC API by sending a POST request to `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with the following JSON data:
```json
{
  "jsonrpc": "1.0",
  "id": "curltest",
  "method": "listaddressgroupings",
  "params": []
}
```
You can use tools like `curl` to send the request.
